Act3Scene2.speaker: Servant
Act3Scene2.text: Ay, madam, but returns again tonight.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Lady Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: Say to the King I would attend his leisure For a few words.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Lady Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: Naught’s had, all’s spent, Where our desire is got without content.
Act3Scene2.translation: We have nothing, everything is spent, when we get what we want without satisfaction.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Lady Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: How now, my lord, why do you keep alone, Of sorriest fancies your companions making? Things without all remedy Should be without regard.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: We have scorched the snake, not killed it. She’ll close and be herself whilst our poor malice Remains in danger of her former tooth.
Act3Scene2.translation: We have only wounded the snake, not killed it. She will recover and be herself again while our weak malice is still in danger of her former venom.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Lady Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: Come on, gentle my lord, Be bright and jovial Among your guests tonight.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: So shall I, love, And so I pray be you. Let your remembrance Apply to Banquo; present him eminence Both with eye and tongue.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: O, full of scorpions is my mind, dear wife! Thou know’st that Banquo and his Fleance lives.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Lady Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: But in them nature’s copy’s not eterne.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: There’s comfort yet; they are assailable. Then be thou jocund.
Act3Scene2.translation: There is still hope; they can be killed. So be joyful.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: Be innocent of the knowledge, dearest chuck, Till thou applaud the deed.

Act3Scene2.speaker: Macbeth
Act3Scene2.text: Things bad begun make strong themselves by ill. So prithee go with me.
Act3Scene2.translation: Things done through bad deeds only grow stronger through more bad deeds. So, please come with me.
